content.question:
Signal transduction may result in changes in gene expression and cell function, which may alter phenotype in an embryo. An example is the expression of the <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> gene, which triggers the male sexual development pathway in mammals. This gene is found on the Y chromosome.
Which statement provides the evidence to justify the claim that signal transduction may result in an altered phenotype?

choices.label: If the <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> gene is absent or nonfunctional, the embryo will exhibit male sexual development.

If the <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> gene is absent or nonfunctional, the embryo will exhibit female sexual development.
An embryo with a male sex chromosome will always exhibit male sexual development.
An embryo with two male sex chromosomes will always exhibit male sexual development.

content.answer: If the <math alttext="S R Y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mi>S</mi><mi>R</mi><mi>Y</mi></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math> gene is absent or nonfunctional, the embryo will exhibit female sexual development.

skill.text: 6.C: Provide reasoning to justify a claim by connecting evidence to biological theories.
